ovdesc.p: The Account Credit Interest table allows special Credit Interest conditions to be defined for individual Accounts when the corresponding Group Credit Interest conditions are not suitable.
To avoid unnecessary work, Account Credit Interest records should only be set up in special cases.
The Account Credit Interest Table allows for a specific Account:
- Interest to be calculated on a Daily, Average, or Minimum balance basis using value dated balances.
- Rates to be fixed or linked to Basic Rates plus or minus a Margin.

- Different rates to be specified for different balance levels which may be linked to the same or different Basic Rates. The rates can apply to the whole of the balance or to the part between two balance levels.

This field represents the last day number to which the minimum balance should be calculated to. The date is used only in conjunction with the BALANCE.TYPE set to MINIMUM.
If a range of days is set then the interest over the accrue period will be calculated on a month to month basis rather than on the entire accrual period.
For example: If the Start date is set to the 10th and the End date set to 31st, then the calculation for interest will be based on the minimum balance on the account between these days for the month.
A numeric number between 1 and 31.
The last day will not overlap into the next accrue period.

Field range CR2.BASIC.RATE to CR2.LIMIT.AMT are used to specify rates applicable to different balance limits. Determines the method by which the Rate specified in corresponding fields CR2.BASIC.RATE or CR2.INT.RATE is adjusted by the Margin specified in corresponding field CR2.MARGIN.RATE. (CR2 fields specify a second interest which may be calculated.)

If the Rate specified in CR2.BASIC.RATE or CR2.INT.RATE is to be adjusted by a Margin, this field specifies whether the Margin Rate is to be added to, subtracted from, or multiplied with the Basic Rate to arrive at the effective interest rate.
If Multiply is specified the final rate is (100 + M) percent of the Rate from CR2.BASIC.RATE or CR2.INT.RATE, where M is the Margin Rate percentage from CR2.MARGIN.RATE.
For examples see CR.BASIC.RATE.

ADD, SUBTRACT or MULTIPLY, or any abbreviation thereof. Multivalue field associated with field range CR2.BASIC.RATE to CR2.LIMIT.AMT. (Optional input. Only allowed if corresponding field CR2.BASIC.RATE or CR2.INT.RATE is input.)
Specifies the Minimum credit Balance, below which interest is not paid. (CR2 fields specify a second interest which may be calculated).
The amount on which interest is to be calculated, (depending on CR2.BALANCE.TYPE), is compared with this field, if less, no interest is calculated.

For example if the minimum balance to be maintained is USD 1,000.00 the value in this field should be set at USD 999.99. This is to maintain consistency with band/level fields where the same logic is used.

Up to 14 type AMT (standard amount format) numeric characters. (Optional input. Not allowed if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS, contains NONE or GENERAL.) Amount entered should be 1 unit or 1 decimal unit under the amount which will attract interest (depending on the number of decimal units in the currency). e.g Enter USD 999.99 for minimum balances of USD 1,000.00 Enter ITL 49,999 for minimum balances of ITL 50,000
Determines whether the calculation will be performed up to the credit balance Level or in Bands (where the interest calculation employed is dependent upon the size of credit balance).

If more than one set of field range CR.BASIC.RATE to CR.LIMIT.AMT are input, this indicates that a different interest rate is applicable depending on the size of the credit balance. CR.CALCUL.TYPE specifies whether separate calculations are to be made for each Band of the credit balance or one is to be made on the entire balance, dependent on the Level of the balance.
Example:
Assume a credit balance of 15,000 and an Account Credit Interest record which specifies an applicable rate of 10 per cent up to 10,000 and 15 per cent above 10,000.
If Band is specified, 2 calculations will be performed, i.e.
10 per cent on 10,000 15 per cent on 5,000
If Level is specified, 1 calculation will be performed, i.e.
15 per cent on 15,000.

BAND or LEVEL or any abbreviation thereof. (Mandatory input if more than one set of field range CR.BASIC.RATE to CR.LIMIT.AMT are specified, otherwise optional. Not allowed if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS contains NONE or GENERAL.)
Defines whether debit interest should be netted against the credit interest prior to calculating tax.

f this is set to Y (yes) then the debit interest due in the capitalisation period will be offset against the credit interest when tax is calculated. Note CR will be netted with DR and CR2 with DR2 and tax calculated individually. Also the debit interest capitalisation frequency must match the credit in order for the netting to take place.

Field range CR.BASIC.RATE to CR.LIMIT.AMT are used to specify rates applicable to different balance limits. Specifies a floating Basic Rate which is held on the BASIC.INTEREST (Ref: General Tables) rate table.
Rates can be fixed or linked to Basic Rates plus or minus a Margin.

1-4 numeric characters. Multivalue field associated with field range CR.BASIC.RATE to CR.LIMIT.AMT. (Optional input. Not allowed if corresponding CR.INT.RATE, is input or if INTEREST.DAY.BASIS, contains NONE or GENERAL.) There must be a record in the BASIC.INTEREST table (Ref: General Tables) with a key consisting of this code, the Currency of the Account and an effective date which is less than or equal to the date specified in ID. Examples: The rate or rates of interest which will be applied are defined by the following multivalue group of fields: BASIC RATE INT RATE MARGIN OPER MARGIN RATE LIMIT AMOUNT Examples of their use is as follows: 1) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate, only enter the following field: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate. 2) If the interest rate is to be fixed, only enter the following field: INT RATE - the actual rate of interest. 3) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate minus a Margin, enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Base Rate MARGIN OPER - SUBTRACT MARGIN RATE - the Marginal Rate. 4) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate plus a Percentage of the floating Basic Rate, enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - MULTIPLY MARGIN RATE - Percentage to be added 5) If the interest rate is to be equal to a floating Basic Rate, minus a margin up to a limiting amount and a floating Basic Rate, minus a different margin above that limiting amount, enter the following fields: BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - SUBTRACT MARGIN RATE - Rate to be subtracted LIMIT AMOUNT- The limit amount for the above defined rate BASIC RATE - Code of the applicable Basic Rate MARGIN OPER - SUBTRACT MARGIN RATE - Rate to be subtracted

Not more than 6 integers may be entered.

There are 3 options (YES, BLOCK.MARGIN and NO/Blank)
Blank or NO
Indicates that negative rates cannot be input and if a rate becomes negative as a result of the application of a margin the rate will be set to zero
YES
Indicates that negative rates can be input and if the application margin makes the rate more negative
then the more negative rate will be used.
BLOCK.MARGIN
Indicates that negative rates can be used but the following conditions apply
- If the rate is positive and the margin makes the rate negative then the rate will be set to zero
- If the rate is negative and the margin makes the rate more negative then the margin will be ignored and the original negative rate is used
